help.long:
Windows Hosts Manager via WSL
Manage your Windows 'hosts' file from WSL.

Usage:
  winhost --add <domain> [ip]     Add a domain to the Windows hosts file.
                                  If no IP is provided, defaults to your configured default IP.

  winhost --remove <domain>       Remove a domain from the Windows hosts file.

Options:
  -a, --add       Add a new host entry
  -r, --remove    Remove an existing host entry
  -h, --help      Show help message

Examples:
  winhost --add domain.test               # Uses default IP
  winhost --add domain.test 192.168.0.1   # Uses custom IP
  winhost --remove domain.test
help.short:
Usage: winhost [options] <domain> [ip]
Options: -a (add), -r (remove), -h (help)
Example: winhost -a domain.test
         winhost -r domain.test
         winhost -h

For more details, use --help
